children.name: mix a2
children.definition: mix tomixdifferent liquids or substances together so that they can no longer be separated:trộn , pha lẫn ,hòa lẫn
examples: mix sth and sth
you can make green by mixing blue and yellow paint.
mix sth together
mix all the ingredients together in a large bowl.
if these two chemicals are mixed together, they will explode.
mix sth with sth
concrete is made by mixing gravel with sand, cement, and water.

children.name: stir b1
children.definition: stir to mix things by moving them around in a container with a spoon or a stick:khuấy, quấy, trộn, pha
examples: stir the paint to make sure that the colours are thoroughly mixed.
stir sth into sth
i watched him as he stirred sugar into his coffee.
stir in sth/stir sth in
when the butter has melted, stir in the soy sauce and ginger.
add the grated cheese to the sauce and stir it in.

children.name: blend x
children.definition: blend to mix liquids or soft substances when you are preparing food, in order to make one smooth substance, using sth such as a fork or special machine:trộn lẫn, pha trộn
examples: blend the sugar, eggs, and flour.
blend sth together
the ingredients should be blended together until they are smooth.
blend sth into sth
beat the egg yolks with 2 tablespoons of water and blend them into the white sauce.

children.name: combine b2
children.definition: combine to mix different substances or liquids together thoroughly in order to produce a new substance or liquid:kết hợp
examples: combine sth and sth
combine the egg yolks and the cream, and cook over a low heat.
combine sth with sth
steel is produced by combining iron with carbon.
to maintain a constant standard, some wine producers combine this year’s wine with stocks from the previous year.

children.name: beat c1
children.definition: beat to mix liquids or soft substances together when you are preparing food, with quick, strong movements of a fork, spoon, or special machine:khuấy, trộn, đánh
examples: carry on beating the eggs with a fork until they’re light and fluffy.
beat sth together
in a separate bowl, beat together the oil and flour.
beat sth into sth
beat the cream into the fruit puree, pour into bowls, and chill.

children.name: whisk x
children.definition: whisk to mix foods that are soft or liquid very quickly so that air is mixed in, especially using a fork or special tool:đánh
examples: whisk the eggs and sugar in a bowl over a pan of hot water.
whisk sth together
he whisked the butter and eggs together, wondering if this was the right way to make an omelette.

children.name: dilute x
children.definition: dilute to mix a liquid with water in order to make it weaker:pha loãng
examples: for babies, dilute the fruit juice with at least the same amount of water.
dilute sth with sth
concentrated bleach can be diluted with water.

children.name: fold in x
children.definition: fold sth in/ fold sth into sth (in cooking) to mix a substance into a mixture by turning it gently with a spoon: trộn
examples: fold in the flour.
fold in the beaten egg whites.
fold the egg whites into the cake mixture.

children.name: cut a2
children.definition: cut cắt
examples: do you want me to cut the cake?
cut sth into pieces/chunk
cut the fish into four pieces and serve hot or warm.

children.name: chop b2
children.definition: chop/ chop up to cut sth such asvegetablesormeatinto small pieces when you are preparing a meal:chặt nhỏ, băm nhỏ , thái nhỏ
examples: chop two onions for the stew.
elsa was in the kitchen chopping up vegetables.
chop sth into pieces/ chunks/ cubes
could you chop the eggplant into cubes for me?
chopped[attri adj]
next, sprinkle some chopped walnuts on the salad.

children.name: slice b2
children.definition: slice to cut food such as bread, meat, or vegetables into thin flat pieces:lạng, cắt lát
examples: wash and slice the mushrooms.
sliced[attri adj]cắt lát
sliced white bread

children.name: carve x
children.definition: carve to cut a large piece of cooked meat into pieces:cắt, xái (thịt chín)
examples: you start carving while i fetch the vegetables.
who’s going to carve the turkey?

children.name: mince x
children.definition: minceuk /grindus  to cut raw meat into very small pieces, usually in amachine:xay, băm
examples: mince the meat and mix in the remaining ingredients.
minced/mɪnst/ ground[attri adj]
minced beef

children.name: grate x
children.definition: grate to cutcheeseorvegetablesinto small thin pieces by rubbing them against a metal surface with holes in it:nạo
examples: i always like to grate some cheese over the potatoes before serving them.
grated[attri adj]
grated orange peel

children.name: shred x
children.definition: shred to cut food, especially vegetables with leaves, into long thin pieces:xắt nhỏ, cắt vụn
examples: remove the outside leaves and shred the cabbage finely.
shredded
a salad consisting of a few bits of shredded lettuce.

children.name: dice c2
children.definition: dice to cut food, especially raw vegetables, into small square pieces:thái hạt lựu
examples: dice the potatoes and cook them in salted water.
diced[attri adj]
melt three tablespoons of butter in a saucepan and add the diced vegetables.

children.name: knead x
children.definition: knead to press dough (= a mixture of flour and water ) many times with your hands when you are making bread: nhào (bột)
examples: kneadthedoughfor three minutes.
knead the dough until smooth.

children.name: stuff x
children.definition: stuff to fill a chicken, pepper etc with a mixture of bread or rice, onion etc before cooking it: nhồi
examples: stuff the turkey, then put it into a pre-heated oven.
stuffed[adj] filled with a stuffing :
stuffed peppers

children.name: baste x
children.definition: baste to pour hot fat and liquid over meat while it is cooking phết mỡ; quết mỡ
examples: baste the turkey at regular intervals.
baste the potatoes occasionally.

children.name: melt b2
children.definition: melt if food melts or if heat melts it, it becomes liquid : nấu chảy
examples: melt the butter in a saucepan.
melt the butter, chocolate, and 1 teaspoon of cream over a low heat.

children.name: marinate x
children.definition: marinate to put meat or fish in a marinade, or to be left in a marinade for some time ướp (thịt/cá)
examples: marinate in sth
fish marinated in olive oil, garlic and vinegar
marinate sth in sth
marinate the chicken in white wine for a couple of hours before frying.

children.name: crush c2
children.definition: crushto use a lot of force to break something such as seeds into very small pieces or into a powder : giã
examples: add one clove of crushed garlic.
crush two cloves of garlic.

children.name: bubble c2
children.definition: bubble to produce bubbles : sôi sùng sục
examples: we could hear the porridge bubblingaway(= bubbling strongly) in the pot.
heat the cheese until it bubbles.

children.name: leave sth stand x
children.definition: let sth standto leave something somewhere, before you do something else with it :let the mixture stand for a couple of hours so that it cools naturally.

children.name: skim x
children.definition: skim to remove sth from the surface of a liquid, especially floating fat, solids, or oil : hớt bọt, hớt váng
examples: skim sth from sth
after simmering the meat, skim the fat from the surface.
skim sth off/ skim off sth
strain the cooking liquid and skimoffthefat.

children.name: to make food or drink look nice
garnish x
children.definition: garnish to makefoodlook nice or to add taste to it by adding a small amount of another type of food, often of a different colour: bày biện ,trang hoàng, tô điểm
examples: before serving the pie, add a little parsley to garnish it.
garnish sth with sth
garnish the salad with tropical fruits and sautéed wild mushrooms.

children.name: drizzle x
children.definition: drizzleto pour a liquid onto food in small drops or in a small stream – often used in cooking instructions : "mưa phùn"
examples: drizzle a little olive oil onto the bread.
drizzle the lemon juice over the cake.
drizzle the soy sauce over the chicken.

children.name: to improve the flavour of food or drink
sweeten x
children.definition: sweeten to make sth taste sweet or sweeter:
examples: sprinkle sugar onto the cooked fruit to sweeten it.
a can of sweetened milk
sweeten the mixture with a little honey.

children.name: spice x
children.definition: spice to add spice to food : cho gia vị, bỏ gia vị
examples: ahighlyspiced curry
spice with
baked apples spiced with cinnamon
coffee spicedwithcinnamon

children.name: season x
children.definition: season to improve the flavour of savoury food by adding salt, herbs or spices when cooking or preparing it : nêm
examples: drain the rice, stir in the salmon and seasonto taste(= so that it has the taste you like).
mix andseason to taste(= add the amount of salt etc that you think tastes right).
season sth with sth
season the chicken with pepper.

children.name: salt x
children.definition: salt to add salt to or put salt on sth : rắc muối, nêm muối;
examples: don't forget to salt the potatoes.

children.name: flavour x
children.definition: flavourukflavorus  to give a particular taste to food or drink: tăng gia vị, tăng mùi vị
examples: this sauce is flavoured with garlic and herbs.
you can use fresh herbs to flavour the soup.

children.name: toss x
children.definition: toss a pancakeuk to quickly and suddenly lift the pan in which a pancake (= thin, flat round cake) is cooking so that the pancake goes up into the air and turns over before falling back into the pan: lật chảo

children.name: flip
children.definition: to make a flat object such as a coin go upwards and turn over in the air:
examples: weflippedacointo see who would go first.
there’s quite an art to flipping pancakes.

children.name: strain x
children.definition: strain to separate solid things from a liquid by pouring the mixture through something with very small holes in it: làm ráo nước
examples: could you strain the vegetables, please.
i usually strain the juiceoffthe pineapple and use it in another recipe.
she strained the pasta.

children.name: sieve x
children.definition: sieveuk/siftus to put flour or other powders through a sieve: giần, sàng, rây
examples: sift the flour and cocoa before adding to the rest of the mixture.
when the cake is cooked, sift some icing sugar over the top of it.
sieve the flour and cocoa powder into a bowl.
to make the pastry, sieve the flour and salt into a mixing bowl.
